Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. No. 1 -- 4.00 Mills - BOC - 20 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the West Feliciana Fire Protection District No. 1, Parish of West Feliciana, State of Louisiana ("the District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Constitution of Louisiana, Part I of Chapter 7 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect an ad valorem tax of 4.00 mills ("the Tax") in each calendar year on all property subject to taxation in the West Feliciana Fire Protection District No. 1, Parish of West Feliciana, for a period of twenty (20) years, commencing in the year 2019 to and including the year 2038 (an estimated $1,100,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for the entire first year, and this amount will increase if the value of property subject to taxation increases), and shall the avails or proceeds of said Tax be used for the purpose of maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District, including salaries and benefits, and paying the costs of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?
